basicthird-person3dcharactertemplateingo.description_text: Third-Person Character Controller is a functional Godot 4.6 project template of a modern 3D adventure/platformer game with orbit camera, WASD movement, double jumping, sprint mechanics, and basic attack output. It's structured as a clean, modular learning asset ideal for students who want to understand 3D character control, camera management, collision detection, enemy AI systems, and third-person game mechanics.  The project includes dedicated scripts for player control (player_controller.gd), camera management (orbit_camera.gd), enemy behavior (enemy.gd), and UI systems (game_ui.gd). All game entities use simple geometric shapes with proper collision layers for easy customization. The template demonstrates best practices for smooth character movement, camera collision avoidance, state machines, input buffering, and modular script architecture.

beyondthebasics_thecompleteguidetoadvanc.human_name: Beyond the Basics: The Complete Guide to Advanced Algorithms for Modern Developers
beyondthebasics_thecompleteguidetoadvanc.description_text:
Break through the intermediate plateau where basic algorithms aren't enough and tackle complex problems that require sophisticated computational thinking.

  • Master advanced algorithmic techniques like dynamic programming and greedy algorithms.
  • Analyze time and space complexity for real-world optimization decisions.
  • Solve challenging problems involving strings, arrays, and advanced data manipulation.
  • Apply algorithmic strategies to system design and scalability challenges.
  • Develop the problem-solving intuition that separates senior developers from juniors.

This course is designed for developers ready to move beyond tutorials and handle genuinely difficult computational challenges. By the end, you'll approach complex problems with confidence and choose the right algorithmic strategies for performance-critical applications.

lostinthewoods_3dvisualnovelgametemplate.human_name: Lost in the Woods - 3D Visual Novel Game Template in Godot 4.6
lostinthewoods_3dvisualnovelgametemplate.description_text:
Unlock immersive storytelling with this complete 3D visual novel framework. The template's dynamic camera system delivers smooth, cinematic transitions between locations with floating animations and interactive object manipulation (rotate the witch's hat, lift the cauldron).

The advanced dialogue system includes typewriter text effects with full character support, while the choice mechanics feature interactive decision points with sophisticated conditional logic that can show or hide options based on story flags. The JSON-based scripting system makes story creation as simple as editing a text file.

Stop building from scratch and start creating immediately! Whether you're creating a single linear narrative or a complex multi-route story with hundreds of choices, this template handles all the technical complexity while giving you complete creative control over your story's content and flow.

vrgamecreationingodot4_fromwebxrsetuptoi.human_name: VR Game Creation in Godot 4: From WebXR Setup to Immersion
vrgamecreationingodot4_fromwebxrsetuptoi.description_text:
Navigate the technical complexity of VR development and create truly immersive experiences that take advantage of the medium's unique possibilities.

  • Set up WebXR and VR environments in Godot 4 from scratch.
  • Design comfortable locomotion and interaction systems that prevent motion sickness.
  • Implement hand tracking, controllers, and natural VR interfaces.
  • Create spatial audio and environmental design for immersion.
  • Optimize performance for smooth, comfortable VR experiences.

This course is designed for developers curious about VR but unsure where to start. By the end, you'll have the technical foundation and design knowledge to create VR games that feel natural and immersive.

generativeaiappdevelopmentmasterclass_bu.human_name: Generative AI App Development Masterclass: Build AI-Powered Projects with Google Gemini in Python, Unreal 5, Godot, and Unity
generativeaiappdevelopmentmasterclass_bu.description_text:
Harness generative AI capabilities across multiple platforms instead of being locked into one ecosystem or struggling with fragmented documentation.

  • Integrate Google Gemini API into Python applications and game engines.
  • Build AI-powered features like dynamic dialogue, content generation, and assistants.
  • Implement generative AI in Unreal 5, Godot, and Unity projects.
  • Handle API calls, responses, and error management effectively.
  • Create practical applications that leverage AI for real user value.

This course is designed for developers who want to add cutting-edge AI features to their projects. By the end, you'll integrate generative AI across multiple platforms and create applications that feel intelligent and responsive.

machinelearninganddeeplearningalgorithms.human_name: Machine Learning and Deep Learning Algorithms: From Fundamentals to Advanced AI
machinelearninganddeeplearningalgorithms.description_text:
Demystify the mathematics and concepts behind ML and deep learning, and gain practical skills to implement algorithms instead of just using black-box libraries.

  • Understand foundational machine learning concepts and when to apply them.
  • Implement algorithms from scratch to grasp how they actually work.
  • Build and train neural networks for various problem types.
  • Explore deep learning architectures and their practical applications.
  • Debug, optimize, and evaluate ML models effectively.

This course is designed for developers and technical professionals who want genuine understanding, not just surface-level familiarity. By the end, you'll have the knowledge to build, train, and deploy machine learning solutions with confidence.

masteringturn-basedrpgdevelopmentingodot.human_name: Mastering Turn-Based RPG Development in Godot 4
masteringturn-basedrpgdevelopmentingodot.description_text:
Conquer the unique challenges of turn-based combat, character progression, and strategic depth that define compelling RPG experiences.

  • Design turn-based combat systems with actions, targeting, and turn order.
  • Implement character stats, progression, and ability systems.
  • Build inventory management and equipment mechanics.
  • Create enemy AI that provides tactical challenge without frustration.
  • Develop battle UI and feedback systems that communicate information clearly.

This course is designed for developers who want to create strategic, engaging RPG combat. By the end, you'll have the technical foundation to build turn-based systems that feel satisfying and reward player planning.

first-person3dcontrollertemplateingodot4.description_text:
This First-Person Controller template for Godot 4 provides everything you need to get your 3D game up and running in minutes. Built with clean, well-documented GDScript, it features smooth WASD movement with acceleration and deceleration, responsive jumping mechanics, a fully functional sprint system, and toggle crouch with automatic ceiling detection. The mouse-look system includes vertical angle clamping and optional head bobbing for added immersion. All parameters are exposed through Godot's Inspector, making it incredibly easy to customize without diving into code. The template uses CharacterBody3D for predictable, game-like physics and includes a complete test level with platforms, walls, and obstacles so you can immediately see all features in action.

Whether you're a beginner learning game development, an intermediate developer wanting to skip the basics, or an experienced programmer needing a solid foundation for rapid prototyping, this template has you covered.

godot46gamefundamentalscrashcourse.description_text:
Master the essentials of Godot 4.6 by creating a 2D coin catcher game from start to finish. This crash course covers scene organization, player movement, collisions, UI design, and game flow — while walking through the logic behind each major line of code.

You’ll build systems for spawning coins, tracking score and time, and handling game-over states using nodes, signals, and physics processing. While no prior Godot knowledge is required, some programming experience will help you follow along smoothly.

The project includes a few simple external assets, clean GDScript code, and a modular structure you can easily expand into your own projects — making it the ideal starting point for learning Godot development.

basicsoncforgameandappdevelopers_buildin.human_name: The Basics on C# for Game and App Developers: Building a Strong Coding Foundation
basicsoncforgameandappdevelopers_buildin.description_text:
Build genuine programming competence in C# instead of copying code you don't understand or getting stuck when problems arise.

  • Master C# syntax, data types, and control structures from the ground up.
  • Understand object-oriented programming concepts through practical examples.
  • Write clean, maintainable code following best practices.
  • Debug effectively and understand error messages.
  • Apply C# fundamentals to both game and application development contexts.

This course is designed for aspiring developers who want to truly understand programming, not just follow tutorials. By the end, you'll write C# code confidently and adapt solutions to your specific needs.

inventoryandequipmentsystemtemplateingod.human_name: Inventory & Equipment System Template in Godot 4.6
inventoryandequipmentsystemtemplateingod.description_text:
An inventory management system with drag-and-drop mechanics, equipment slots, and world item integration. Players can organize items in a slot-based grid, stack resources, equip gear across 8 body slots, and interact with items through intuitive right-click menus and hover tooltips.

This template includes 44 files with 1,309 lines of GDScript, featuring 20 customizable inventory slots, 8 equipment slots (Head, Chest, Weapon, Shield, etc.), drag-and-drop with split-stacking, rarity-colored borders, and both 2D/3D world item pickups. Includes 150+ features: context menus, visual tooltips, auto-stacking, save/load serialization, and 5 example items spanning all rarity tiers.

buildon.description_text:
Donations to support buildOn are made to  PayPal Giving Fund, subject to its policies.

buildOn’s mission is to break the cycle of poverty, illiteracy, and low expectations through service and education. They mobilize U.S. students to transform their communities through service and change the world by building schools in developing countries.

checkers3d_strategicboardgametemplatewit.human_name: Checkers 3D: Strategic Board Game Template with AI in Godot 4.6
checkers3d_strategicboardgametemplatewit.description_text:
A modern 3D implementation of the classic checkers board game with stunning visuals and intelligent gameplay. Players compete to capture opponent pieces or block their moves through strategic positioning, with optional captures allowing tactical depth beyond traditional forced-jump rules. Features a professional wooden checkerboard with realistic materials, clear visual indicators (flat circles for selection and valid moves), and a challenging AI opponent that prioritizes captures, promotions, and board control.

This template includes 24 interactive pieces with collision detection, AI decision system with move evaluation, persistent score tracking across games, match history, and two game modes (Player vs Player and Player vs AI). Features clean architecture with separated game logic, raycasting-based input, comprehensive move validation, and full documentation. Perfect for learning board game AI implementation, 3D click interaction, and turn-based strategy mechanics. Easily customizable for rule variants (International, Russian checkers), difficulty levels, and online multiplayee.

commandlinefoundations_boostyourproducti.human_name: Command Line Foundations: Boost Your Productivity as a Modern Software Developer
commandlinefoundations_boostyourproducti.description_text:
Stop avoiding the terminal and unlock the speed, automation, and power that command-line proficiency brings to your development workflow.

  • Navigate and manipulate files and directories efficiently.
  • Use essential Unix commands and understand when to apply them.
  • Automate repetitive tasks with shell scripts and command chains.
  • Manage version control, packages, and development tools from the terminal.
  • Integrate command-line tools into your daily development workflow.

This course is designed for developers who rely too heavily on GUIs and feel limited by it. By the end, you'll work faster and more efficiently by leveraging the command line as a natural extension of your skillset.

fromcodetocompletion_advancedgodot4progr.human_name: From Code to Completion: Advanced Godot 4 Programming for 3D Platformers
fromcodetocompletion_advancedgodot4progr.description_text:
Move beyond basic tutorials and master the sophisticated programming techniques that separate amateur projects from polished, professional-feeling 3D platformers.

  • Implement advanced character controllers with precise movement and feel.
  • Design camera systems that enhance gameplay and prevent motion sickness.
  • Create state machines and clean architectures for complex character behaviors.
  • Build level streaming and optimization systems for large 3D worlds.
  • Debug and refine physics, collision, and performance bottlenecks.

This course is designed for intermediate developers ready to level up their technical skills. By the end, you'll write cleaner, more maintainable code and create 3D platformers that feel responsive and professional.

buildlowpolygameworlds_designmodelsforgo.human_name: Build Low Poly Game Worlds: Design Models for Godot, Unity, and Unreal
buildlowpolygameworlds_designmodelsforgo.description_text:
Create stylish, performant 3D environments without the technical overhead and file sizes of high-poly models — perfect for indie developers and stylized games.

  • Design low poly models with efficient topology and clean geometry.
  • Create modular assets that combine into complete game environments.
  • Apply materials and textures that enhance the low poly aesthetic.
  • Optimize models for game engines across Godot, Unity, and Unreal.
  • Build complete scenes with lighting and composition that sell the style.

This course is designed for developers who want a distinctive visual style without massive art budgets. By the end, you'll create cohesive low poly worlds that look intentional, not limited.

moderngamedevelopmentwithgodot4gdscripta.human_name: Modern Game Development with Godot 4, GDScript and AI
moderngamedevelopmentwithgodot4gdscripta.description_text:
Stay relevant in an evolving industry by integrating AI tools and contemporary workflows that professional teams now consider standard practice.

  • Leverage AI assistants to accelerate your GDScript development.
  • Implement modern design patterns and architectural approaches.
  • Use AI for rapid prototyping, asset generation, and problem-solving.
  • Combine traditional game development with cutting-edge AI capabilities.
  • Adopt workflows that professional studios are embracing today.

This course is designed for developers who want to work smarter, not just harder. By the end, you'll have a modern, AI-enhanced workflow that increases your productivity and keeps you competitive in the game development landscape.

multiplayerlobbywithchat_godot463dgamete.human_name: Multiplayer Lobby with Chat - Godot 4.6 3D Game Template
multiplayerlobbywithchat_godot463dgamete.description_text:
Retire from the next hit game faster than ever before with this instant multiplayer template! Unlock an exclusive Godot 4.6 game template that lets you host private lobbies for friends or join sessions effortlessly using a room code.

With multiplayer synchronization, your new favorite template enables real-time interaction in a 3D environment, complete with player movement, rotation, and jumping that’s reflected across all connected users. With integrated 3D overhead chat and 2D sidebar chat systems, players can communicate dynamically as they explore and interact, creating a lively and connected gameplay experience.

Your ready-to-use template also includes a bubbly user interface that makes hosting and joining games smooth and intuitive right out of the box. Perfect for developers who want to save time and focus on crafting unique mechanics, worlds, and experiences without the heavy lifting. Start now!

godotforbeginners_learngamedevelopmentfr.human_name: Godot for Beginners: Learn Game Development from Scratch
godotforbeginners_learngamedevelopmentfr.description_text:
Overcome the intimidation of starting game development and build a solid foundation without getting lost in overly technical explanations.

  • Understand the Godot interface and fundamental concepts.
  • Create your first playable games with step-by-step guidance.
  • Learn essential programming concepts in GDScript naturally through game creation.
  • Build basic game mechanics like movement, collision, and scoring.
  • Progress from simple prototypes to complete, functioning games.

This course is designed for complete beginners with no prior game development experience. By the end, you'll have the confidence and foundational knowledge to pursue your game development journey independently.

gettingstartedwithgodot_editorandscripti.human_name: Getting Started with Godot: Editor & Scripting Foundations
gettingstartedwithgodot_editorandscripti.description_text:
Start your journey with Godot 4.6 by learning the essentials of its editor and scripting system. This course serves as the ideal introduction before moving on to more advanced projects, helping you understand how everything in Godot fits together.

You’ll begin with a guided tour of the Godot Editor, covering installation, scene organization, node hierarchies, and project settings. Then you’ll move into GDScript fundamentals, where you’ll learn how to attach scripts, work with variables and functions, use annotations like @export and @onready, and respond to input through simple examples.

Each lecture includes short, practical activities such as multiple-choice questions, fill-in-the-blank prompts, and code-based exercises that reinforce key concepts without overwhelming you.

By the end, you’ll feel confident navigating the editor, writing basic scripts, and understanding how scenes, nodes, and code work together, giving you the foundation needed to follow along easily in other Godot courses and projects.

godot4gamecodecollection_buildfasterwith.human_name: Godot 4 Game Code Collection: Build Faster with Game Templates and Code Snippets
godot4gamecodecollection_buildfasterwith.description_text:
Stop reinventing the wheel for common gameplay mechanics and systems — access battle-tested code you can drop into projects and customize immediately.

  • Access a comprehensive library of ready-to-use game code snippets.
  • Understand how each template works and how to modify it.
  • Implement common mechanics like inventory, dialogue, and save systems quickly.
  • Customize templates to match your specific game requirements.
  • Build games faster by combining proven code patterns.

This course is designed for developers who want to prototype and ship games faster. By the end, you'll have a personal code library that accelerates every project and eliminates repetitive implementation work.

makeaminimalist2dgeometrysurvivalgameing.human_name: Make a Minimalist 2D Geometry Survival Game in Godot 4.6 - From Scratch
makeaminimalist2dgeometrysurvivalgameing.description_text:
Build a fast-paced shape-dodging game while learning the fundamentals of 2D gameplay programming in Godot 4. This hands-on project focuses on reactive movement, collision systems, and smooth animation — all created entirely without external assets.

You’ll learn how to:

  • Draw and animate dynamic ring shapes using Polygon2D.
  • Control real-time rotation and input with _physics_process().
  • Detect and respond to collisions using Area2D and signals.
  • Apply tweens for scaling, shrinking, and smooth transitions.
  • Combine logic and design for simple but addictive gameplay.

Master the essentials of Godot’s 2D engine by building a fun, complete game from pure code and geometry — proving great gameplay doesn’t need art assets.

godot4leveldesignmasterclass_buildacompl.human_name: Godot 4 Level Design Masterclass: Build a Complete Ninja Adventure Game
godot4leveldesignmasterclass_buildacompl.description_text:
Experience the complete journey from empty scene to finished game by designing every level, challenge, and moment of a cohesive ninja adventure.

  • Plan and prototype level flows that support stealth and action gameplay.
  • Design enemy placements, patrol routes, and encounter spaces.
  • Create environmental puzzles and navigation challenges.
  • Build progression through areas with escalating difficulty and new mechanics.
  • Polish transitions, pacing, and narrative beats through level design.

This course is designed for developers who learn best by building complete projects. By the end, you'll understand how individual levels connect into a full game experience — and have a portfolio-ready ninja adventure to show for it.

mastering2dplatformerleveldesigningodot4.human_name: Mastering 2D Platformer Level Design in Godot 4: From Parkour Speedrunners to Themed Worlds
mastering2dplatformerleveldesigningodot4.description_text:
Transform flat, forgettable levels into memorable experiences that challenge players and support diverse playstyles, from precision speedrunning to exploratory adventure.

  • Design parkour sequences with flow, rhythm, and satisfying movement chains.
  • Create themed worlds with distinct visual identities and gameplay flavors.
  • Build levels that accommodate both speedrunners and casual players.
  • Implement difficulty curves and teaching moments through environmental design.
  • Balance challenge, pacing, and player progression across multiple stages.

This course is designed for developers who want their levels to be more than obstacle courses. By the end, you'll craft 2D platformer levels that players remember, replay, and praise for their thoughtful design.

particleffectmastery2dand3dingodot4withc.human_name: Particle Effect Mastery: 2D & 3D Visual FX in Godot 4 with C#
particleffectmastery2dand3dingodot4withc.description_text:
Add the visual polish and impact that transforms competent games into experiences players rave about, using particle systems and effects that communicate action and emotion.

  • Create explosive, dynamic particle effects for both 2D and 3D games.
  • Design visual feedback for abilities, impacts, and environmental effects.
  • Control particles through C# for responsive, gameplay-driven VFX.
  • Optimize particle systems for performance without sacrificing visual quality.
  • Build reusable effect systems you can adapt across multiple projects.

This course is designed for developers who know their games need more visual punch. By the end, you'll create effects that make every action feel satisfying and give your games the professional polish they deserve.

godot4gameproject_designandcodea3droller.human_name: Godot 4 Game Project: Design and Code a 3D Roller Race in C#
godot4gameproject_designandcodea3droller.description_text:
Master C# in Godot through focused, project-based learning instead of abstract tutorials that leave you wondering how to apply the concepts.

  • Build a complete 3D racing game from first line to final build.
  • Implement vehicle physics and responsive racing controls in C#.
  • Design tracks, obstacles, and racing mechanics that feel exciting.
  • Structure your C# code for maintainability and performance.
  • Polish gameplay with visual feedback, audio, and game feel improvements.

This course is designed for developers who want to learn C# in Godot by building something concrete. By the end, you'll have both a finished game and practical C# skills you can apply to future projects.

basic2dplatformerstartertemplateingodot4.human_name: Basic 2D Platformer Starter Template in Godot 4.6
basic2dplatformerstartertemplateingodot4.description_text:
A 2D platformer starter project for Godot 4.6 with classic Mario-style physics and all core mechanics working out of the box. This template includes floaty jump physics with variable height, enemy stomping mechanics, coin collection, a lives system, countdown timer, and complete UI (HUD, pause menu, game over screen). Two fully playable demo levels showcase the tilemap system, enemy AI, and level progression. Every script is heavily commented with over 800 lines of documentation explaining not just what the code does, but why it works that way.

Built for developers who want to skip the tedious setup and jump straight into creating gameplay. The modular architecture makes it easy to customize - adjust movement speed, jump height, and physics behavior through simple Inspector values, or extend the system with your own features. Perfect for beginners learning 2D game development, game jam participants needing a solid foundation, or experienced developers who want a reliable starting point. Pure GDScript with no dependencies, no plugins, and no complicated setup - just extract, import into Godot, and press F5 to play. Includes everything you need to start building your own 2D platformer today.

integratingswiftwithgodot4_buildcustomex.human_name: Integrating Swift with Godot 4: Build Custom Extensions for Your Games
integratingswiftwithgodot4_buildcustomex.description_text:
Extend Godot's capabilities with native Swift code for iOS features, performance optimization, and functionality that GDScript alone can't provide.

  • Set up Swift integration with Godot 4 projects.
  • Create custom modules and extensions using Swift.
  • Access iOS-specific features and native APIs.
  • Bridge communication between GDScript and Swift code.
  • Optimize performance-critical game systems with native code.

This course is designed for developers targeting iOS who need more than Godot's built-in capabilities. By the end, you'll confidently extend Godot with Swift to create iOS games with native performance and features.

buildon.description_text:
Donations to support buildOn are made to  PayPal Giving Fund, subject to its policies.

buildOn’s mission is to break the cycle of poverty, illiteracy, and low expectations through service and education. They mobilize U.S. students to transform their communities through service and change the world by building schools in developing countries.

from_bundle.tile_short_name: Massive Godot Game Development Template and Online Course Bundle+
from_bundle.short_marketing_blurb: Discover your creative greatness with Godot
from_bundle.marketing_blurb: Get Match-3 Game Template in Godot 4.6, Godot 4.6 Game Fundamentals Crash Course, Integrating Swift with Godot 4: Build Custom Extensions for Your Games, and more!
from_bundle.detailed_marketing_blurb: Start your new career in game development with a little help from the pros at Mammoth Club! Create engaging characters and dynamic levels with beta-ready templates, learn foundational development techniques through expert-led courses, and so much more. Build your own puzzle games, platformers, and first-person shooters—even get into the real nuts and bolts of game development by creating your own multiplayer lobbies with chat! Get massive savings on the tools and techniques you need to succeed as a game developer, and help support buildOn with your purchase.
from_bundle.author: Mammoth Interactive

basic_data.human_name: Humble RPG Bundle: Last Call for Lankhmar by Goodman Games
basic_data.detailed_marketing_blurb:
Gather your party and take a trip to a city full of adventure and surprise with this bundle of Lankhmar tabletop RPG resources from Dungeon Crawl Classics! Get the entire Lankhmar saga and 15 distinct adventures set within the legendary city, including fan favorites like “The Greatest Thieves in Lankhmar,” “Gang Lords of Lankhmar,” “Blasphemy and Larceny in Lankhmar,” and more! Bring your story to life with the Lankhmar Printed Boxed Set & Adventure Bundle, which features printed maps, the Compendium of Secret Knowledge, and more new material with all the twists and turns needed to satisfy newcomers and veteran players alike. Grab everything you need for your next adventure at the price of your choice, and all purchases support the No Kid Hungry campaign from nonprofit Share Our Strength.

Note: Due to limited quantities, the $40 physical tier is no longer available.
basic_data.description:
Welcome to Lankhmar. Gather your party and take a trip to a city full of adventure and surprise with this bundle of Lankhmar tabletop RPG resources from Dungeon Crawl Classics! Get the entire Lankhmar saga and 15 distinct adventures set within the legendary city, including fan favorites like “The Greatest Thieves in Lankhmar,” “Gang Lords of Lankhmar,” “Blasphemy and Larceny in Lankhmar,” and more! Bring your story to life with the Lankhmar Printed Boxed Set & Adventure Bundle, which features printed maps, the Compendium of Secret Knowledge, and more new material with all the twists and turns needed to satisfy newcomers and veteran players alike. Grab everything you need for your next adventure at the price of your choice, and all purchases support the No Kid Hungry campaign from nonprofit Share Our Strength.

Pay $1 or more. Normally, the total cost for the ebooks in this bundle is as much as $373. Here at Humble Bundle, you choose the price and increase your contribution to upgrade your bundle! This bundle has a minimum $1 purchase.

Redeem your keys. The ebooks in this bundle are redeemable on the drivethrurpg.com website. Instructions and a list of recommended reading programs can be found here.

Support charity. Choose where the money goes - between the publisher and to support No Kid Hungry/Share Our Strength. If you like what we do, you can leave us a Humble Tip too!

The titles in this bundle are available through: DriveThruRPG

dungeoncrawlclassicsrpgcorerulebookdcc.human_name: Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG Core Rulebook
dungeoncrawlclassicsrpgcorerulebookdcc.description_text:
Glory & Gold Won by Sorcery & Sword

You’re no hero.

You’re an adventurer: a reaver, a cutpurse, a heathen-slayer, a tight-lipped warlock guarding long-dead secrets. You seek gold and glory, winning it with sword and spell, caked in the blood and filth of the weak, the dark, the demons, and the vanquished. There are treasures to be won deep underneath, and you shall have them. 

Return to the glory days of fantasy with the Dungeon Crawl Classics Role-Playing Game. Adventure as 1974 intended, with modern rules grounded in the origins of sword & sorcery. Fast play, cryptic secrets, and a mysterious past await you: turn the page...

RULES SET

DCC RPG is a fast-paced, open-feeling rules set allowing for epic game experiences without unnecessary tethers. It uses modern game-play while paying homage to the origins of role-playing and the fun that it inspired. This is the 11th printing of the DCC RPG rules.

PRODUCT SUPPORT

Goodman Games supports DCC RPG with adventures, settings, yearbooks, and sourcebooks based on Appendix N authors. Goodman Games has released over 40 adventures for DCC RPG, and more are in the pipeline. Beyond the core rulebook, there are settings that expand your experience with DCC RPG. These settings include DCC Lankhmar (licensed from the estate of Fritz Lieber), DCC Dying Earth (licensed from the estate of Jack Vance), The Shudder Mountains (inspired by the works of Manly Wade Wellman), Mutant Crawl Classics (a stand-alone, post-apocalyptic, science-fantasy setting), Empire of the East, and Xcrawl Classics. All supplements use the Dungeon Crawl Classics core rules.

COMMUNITY

DCC RPG has an active community fan base. There are many online communities as well as physical gatherings worldwide. Scores of events are run annually at conventions and gatherings around the world, both physical and online, including a massive team tournament at Gen Con each year. A number of fan websites exist to provide community content, such as character generators, dice rolling tools, and more. (We suggest you start with the Purple Sorcerer’s site!) Our Gen Con booth is the annual gathering of the fans, featuring a Gong of Doom and Obelisks of Doom.

THIRD-PARTY RELEASES

Goodman Games offers a free license that allows fans to create rules and settings that customize the game in amazing ways. With over 200 fan-created products on the market, you can find almost any setting and mod that you desire.

CONTRIBUTORS

Many of the top creators in the industry have lent a hand creating for DCC RPG and the adventures that go with it. The writing team includes Joseph Goodman, Harley Stroh, Michael Curtis, Brendan LaSalle, and many others. The art team includes Doug Kovacs, Stefan Poag, Peter Mullen, Brad McDevitt, Russ Nicholson, Sanjulian, Jeff Easley, Erol Otus, and many others.

REVIEWS

Here's an excerpt from our favorite review (you can find the whole review here):

- “This isn’t your father’s D&D...it’s your batsh*t crazy uncle’s D&D, straight from the smokey basement with faded black-light posters on the walls and 80’s Manowar blaring on the old tape deck. You might turn up your nose at first, but once the seven-sided-dice start rolling you find yourself sucked in.”

Here are some other reviews:

- Year of the Dungeon: “Goodman took a very old-school point of view and made a game that manages to offer a fresh perspective on many aspects of the game while loving maintaining all the core tenets of old school play. More importantly, the game doesn’t just provide rules, but it’s a primer on how to get the most out of its chosen style of play.”

- Game Knight Reviews: “The DCC RPG book has a suggested retail price of $39.95, which I think is quite reasonable in an age when smaller hardcover books are going for the same general price point. But when you think about all the art in the book, $40 is a steal. And that’s part of my point about it being distracting. I turn the page and get lost in the art, some of which is amazingly detailed and then I have to reread the page prior to remember what I was reading about.”

- Raven Crowking's Nest: “Having read the Dungeon Crawl Classics core rulebook rather exhaustively now, I am coming to the conclusion that this will be my go-to game for all time.”

- EN World: “Make no mistake, DCC RPG is not for everyone and it does not try to be. Randomization, heavy use of tables, critical fumbles, and no multiclassing are strong departures from what many new gamers have become accustomed to.”

Written by: Joseph Goodman, Harley Stroh, Michael Curtis, Brendan LaSalle, et. al.

Art by: Doug Kovacs, Stefan Poag, Peter Mullen, Brad McDevitt, Russ Nicholson, Sanjulian, Jeff Easley, Erol Otus, et. al.

dcclankhmar_issue4_violenceforvotishal.description_text:
A level 4 adventure set in Lankhmar!

Votishal the Silent is on the rise! Ascending from antiquity, the religion threatens to dominate Lankhmar’s Street of the Gods. Alas, something is killing the clergy! Desperately offering a fortune in reward, they’ve abandoned their temple. But it is by no means vacant. Intrepid souls must face nickers, alley-bashers, and magical guardians, while avoiding sinister traps to uncover the building’s secrets. Even the sewers have something to hide. Only keen minds and blades can stop the violence for Votishal!

Written by: Terry Olson

Cover Art by: Doug Kovacs

Officially licensed from the Estate of Fritz Leiber

dcclankhmar_issue11mapsandtokenspack.description_text:
The perfect accessory to play DCCL #11: The Rats of Ilthmar on a virtual tabletop! This set of maps and tokens allows you to bring stunning visuals to your online session. All art is from hand-painted originals, scanned and formatted for online play. The look and feel of these tokens capture the spirit of DCC gaming and its Appendix N origins, yet is scaled and prepared for play online.

Inside this map+token pack you will find:

Two large maps, The Temple of the Rat and the Rat Temple Catacombs, hand-painted in full color. Each map is offered in a gridded and grid-free format.

Two-color player handouts.

More than 60 monster tokens, representing the foes in the adventure: rats, giant rats, rat wights, ratman berserkers, rat priests and cultists, rat swarms, evil sailors, worshippers, primordial slime, the catacomb guardian, and more.

24 player character tokens, representing 12 different Lankhmar character types, each with a male and female version. Thieves, wizards, and warriors a-plenty!

This VTT map+token pack is designed to be played with Dungeon Crawl Classics Lankhmar #11: The Rats of Ilthmar. You can use the graphics herein without the adventure, but you’ll get the most out of them if you also own the adventure.

dcclankhmar_masksoflankhmar.description_text:
A level 1 adventure for DCC Lankhmar!

A heist gone wrong brings an unlikely group of thieves together and sets off a search for forgotten treasures hidden in the City of the Black Toga! Can our heroes of questionable moral character survive the twisting chase that leads through the Plaza of Dark Delights, crosses paths with Sheelba of the Eyeless Face, and delves into one of the oddest tenements in Lankhmar? Not if the Thieves’ Guild has their way!

Masks of Lankhmar is the inaugural adventure written for Goodman Games’ new DCC Lankhmar line of supplements produced with the approval of the Estate of Fritz Leiber. This 1st level adventure is specially designed to start a DCC Lankhmar game set in the City of Sevenscore Thousand Smokes and provides the judge with the perfect means to assemble the players and kick off the campaign. That is, assuming they survive, of course! Look for more DCC Lankhmar supplemental material coming soon from Goodman Games.

Written by: Michael Curtis

Cover Art by: Doug Kovacs

Authorized by the Estate of Fritz Leiber

freerpgday2016_dcclankhmarandmccrpg.human_name: Free RPG Day 2016 - DCC Lankhmar / MCC RPG
freerpgday2016_dcclankhmarandmccrpg.description_text:
Our Free RPG Day offering this year contains two new adventures for DCC RPG. Each of these adventures expands the direction of DCC RPG for an exciting new setting: the first is the world of Fritz Leiber’s Lankhmar, and the second is Mutant Crawl Classics!

The Madhouse Meet is a level 1 adventure for DCC Lankhmar by Michael Curtis. It throws a group of beginning adventurers together, requiring them to work in concert to escape the clutches of a bizarre sorcerer from lands far beyond Lankhmar.

Download pregenerated characters for this adventure here!

The Museum at the End of Time is an introductory adventure for Mutant Crawl Classics by Jim Wampler. In this adventure, the Tribe of the Cog’s rite of passage sends young adventurers out into the Glow Desert, where they discover and explore a well preserved museum of the Ancient Ones.

Download pregenerated characters for this adventure here!

The 2016 Free RPG Day module came in five different covers — and this PDF version contains them all!

Written by: Michael Curtis and Jim Wampler

dcclankhmar_issue3_actingupinlankhmar.human_name: DCC Lankhmar #3: Acting Up in Lankhmar
dcclankhmar_issue3_actingupinlankhmar.description_text:
A level 2 adventure set in Lankhmar!

A corrupt Duke of Lankhmar’s foibles paraded before the masses for their entertainment puts an acting troupe in trouble. Threatened by the insulted Duke and his private guard, the performers need assistance to make it through their final performance of “The Fiascos of Duke Hogfat.” With nobody else to turn to, the troupe hires the PCs as their evening’s protectors. Will the play end in a standing ovation or will the Duke and his thugs bring down the house on the troupe and their defenders?

Written by: Michael Curtis

Cover Art by: William McAusland

Officially licensed from the Estate of Fritz Leiber

dcclankhmar_issue9_gravematters.description_text:
A level 2 adventure set in Lankhmar!

Skullduggery and sorcery in the streets of Lankhmar! Herein you will find two adventures set in the seedy underworld of the city.

In the first, the party must steal back a stolen sarcophagus from the grips of a macabre smuggling ring. The second concerns a band of questionable heroes thrown together by misfortune who must fight their way out of an unearthly wizard’s lair—a perfect way to start a new DCC Lankhmar campaign!

Both demonstrate that there’s no dearth of thrills, dangers, and, of course, wealth to be found in (and under) the city of Lankhmar. Do you have what it takes to make it through the night?

Written by: Michael Curtis

Cover Art by: Doug Kovacs

Officially licensed from the Estate of Fritz Leiber

dccday2020adventurepack.description_text:
From DCC Day 2020! Three all-new adventures!

Enter the amazing worlds of Dungeon Crawl Classics! DCC Day is our chance to say "thanks" to fans for their support, and by "thanks" what we really mean is, have a great game on us! Inside this adventure pack, you will find three complete and playable adventures for the worlds of Dungeon Crawl Classics!

For DCC RPG, Expedition to Algol is a level 1 adventure transporting the characters to an alien world where human-descended ani-men strive to unearth the secrets of their ancient progenitors.

For DCC Lankhmar, The Heist is a level 3 adventure that sends the character to loot a legendary treasure-hold beneath the pleasure manse of Duke Oraso. But by the end of the night, the Gods of Lankhmar are involved, and things get complicated.

For Mutant Crawl Classics, Ruins of Future Past sends your post-apocalyptic character through a temporal rift into the medieval dungeon lab of a mad wizard who has been researching time-based magics.

Plan your night of adventure! Thank you for supporting DCC RPG and DCC Day!

Download pre-gen characters for these adventures!

Written by: Julian Bernick, Harley Stroh, and Tim Callahan

Cover Art by: Doug Kovacs

dcclankhmar_issue7_adozenlankhmarlocatio.human_name: DCC Lankhmar #7: A Dozen Lankhmar Locations
dcclankhmar_issue7_adozenlankhmarlocatio.description_text:
A setting book for Lankhmar!

Travel the fog-shrouded streets of Lankhmar and visit some of its most infamous sites! From the home of Muulsh the Moneylender to the Silver Eel to the winding passages of Thieves’ House, this book provides the judge with a detailed look at a dozen interesting locales inside the City of the Black Toga.

Suitable for planning adventures or when the players take an unexpected turn, A Dozen Lankhmar Locations provides information and maps to aid any judge running a city-based adventure in the City of Seven-Score Thousand Smokes or other fantasy metropolis.

Written by: Michael Curtis

Cover Art by: William McAusland

Officially licensed from the Estate of Fritz Leiber

lankhmarprintedboxedsetandadventurebundl.human_name: Lankhmar Printed Boxed Set & Adventure Bundle
lankhmarprintedboxedsetandadventurebundl.description_text: This is a PRINT item, redeemed through the Goodman Games online store. This exclusive item for Humble Bundle customers includes more than $120 worth of printed product for only a couple dollars more in bundle price! You'll receive the packed-to-the-gills DCC Lankhmar boxed set (complete with all the books and the massive city map), the hardcover Lankhmar adventure collection, and the printed 15th and last DCC Lankhmar adventure!

dcclankhmar_issue14_thievesofcoldcorner.human_name: DCC Lankhmar #14: Thieves of Cold Corner
dcclankhmar_issue14_thievesofcoldcorner.description_text:
A level 3 DCC adventure set in Lankhmar!

A cache of invisible ice diamonds and an overlord’s ransom in gold rilks—amid the drunken revelry of midwinter solstice, Cold Corner was never riper for a heist.

But to pull it off risks the ire the Snow Women and their skalds—cruel axe-men eager for the chance to prove their devotion to their cold mistresses. And with the power to shape cold - and the blinding blizzards, shattered bones, and frozen bodies that must surely follow—the sorceress matriarchs of the Snow Clan are not to be trifled.

Some would say you'd be a fool to cross the Snow Women north of the Trollstep Mountains. They'd be right, but that's never stopped you before...

- In the grand tradition of Gray Mouser and Fafhrd, a dangerous heist set in a distant land

- Test your arcane mastery in spell battles with the sorcerous Snow Women

- Encounter deadly and strange new foes like the invisible polar worms and the Snow Clan skalds

Written by: Harley Stroh

Cover Art by: Doug Kovacs

Officially licensed from the Estate of Fritz Leiber

monstersandmagicoflankhmar.description_text:
From the fog-shrouded streets of Lankhmar to your gaming table!

Monsters and Magic of Lankhmar is filled with more terrible beasts and new magic than the pages of Skrith of the Scrolls, each presented in a ready-to-use fifth edition format. More than 20 new monsters and over 15 new spells and magical items are included here, each one from the fantastic stories of Fafhrd and the Gray Mouser, as written by world-renowned fantasy author, Fritz Leiber. Produced in cooperation with the Fritz Leiber Estate, Monsters and Magic of Lankhmar is the perfect way to introduce a dash of Lankhmar into your fifth edition campaign or to create adventures set in world of Nehwon—all without the need of Ningauble’s Cave to do so! Get ready to venture to the land of Lankhmar and see what adventure awaits you and your players…

dcclankhmar_issue5_blasphemyandlarcenyin.human_name: DCC Lankhmar #5: Blasphemy and Larceny in Lankhmar
dcclankhmar_issue5_blasphemyandlarcenyin.description_text:
A level 5 adventure set in Lankhmar!

A member of your gang awakens in an alleyway with foggy memories of a deal made, a job taken, a partner slain, and a heist planned. They struggle to remember the details, but you all agree that breaking into an abandoned temple should be a simple matter – in and out. Yet the heist is on a collision course with something sinister.

What begins as an easy job becomes anything but, as you confront cultists, vengeful spirits, and the servitors of a long-forgotten god. While seeking an easy score, you uncover a plan to strike a blow into the heart of Lankhmar, and no one is safe from the blasphemous plot. A choice needs to be made. Will you stand with the city, or risk letting it descend into chaos?

Curse the gods of Lankhmar for their cruel joke that, in the shadowed alleyways of Lankhmar, there is no such thing as a “simple matter.”

Written by: Bob Brinkman

Cover Art by: Jeff Easley

Officially licensed from the Estate of Fritz Leiber

dcclankhmar_issue15_thehouseofjadeandsha.human_name: DCC Lankhmar #15: The House of Jade and Shadow
dcclankhmar_issue15_thehouseofjadeandsha.description_text:
A level 1 adventure for DCC Lankhmar!

An exiled nobleman arrives in Lankhmar bearing a fortune in jewels, spurring the PCs to stage a daring robbery. They soon discover that the noble’s estate also harbors a sinister cult with terrible plans for Lankhmar.

The House of Jade and Shadow is a 1st-level adventure that mixes both role-playing opportunities with rip-roaring action, just like the classic tales of Fafhrd and the Gray Mouser did. This adventure includes multiple player handouts, pitting their minds as well as their sword-arms against horrific foes to escape the House of Jade and Shadow. This adventure is for use with DCC Lankhmar, but can easily be inserted into any DCC RPG campaign with minor adjustments.

Written by: Marzio Muscedere

Art by: Doug Kovacs, William McAusland, Charles Ferguson-Avery, Tom Galambis, Davin Klutz, Cliff Kurowski, Chad Segesketter

Authorized by the Estate of Fritz Leiber

dungeoncrawlclassicslankhmarcampaignsett.human_name: Dungeon Crawl Classics Lankhmar Campaign Setting
dungeoncrawlclassicslankhmarcampaignsett.description_text:
The boxed set officially licensed from the estate of Fritz Leiber!

Enter the thrilling world of Fritz Leiber’s Nehwon, home to the legendary city of Lankhmar and the infamous heroes Fafhrd and the Gray Mouser! Prepare yourself to battle members of the city’s nefarious Thieves’ Guild in fog-shrouded alleys, to barter for cursed curios in the Plaza of Dark Delights, and to seek the wisdom of Ningauble of the Seven Eyes and Sheelba of the Eyeless Face! All this and more is possible with DCC Lankhmar.

This boxed set contains comprehensive rules options and new material for the Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG explicitly designed to capture the unique setting of Nehwon and Lankhmar, the City of the Black Toga. Inside, you’ll find new spells, monsters, magical items, patrons, and rules to make your DCC RPG campaign more like Leiber’s exiting stories—including the popular “Fleeting Luck” mechanic where good fortune blesses your characters one minute, only to dash their hopes the next.

This set also includes a detailed look at Lankhmar and provides the judge with an assortment of descriptions, tables, and adventure ideas to get their DCC Lankhmar campaign up and running with a minimum of effort, including the adventure No Small Crimes in Lankhmar and a beautiful city map illustrated by Doug Kovacs. A copy of the Dungeon Crawl Classics rulebook is required to use this boxed set.

Inside this box you will find:

- The Judge’s Guide to Nehwon (104 pages)

- Compendium of Secret Knowledge (40 pages)

- Lankhmar: City of the Black Toga (44 pages)

- Dungeon Crawl Classics Lankhmar #0: No Small Crimes in Lankhmar (12 pages)

- A gigantic 33” x 17” poster map of the City of Lankhmar

- Another 17” x 11” map of Nehwon

- A 3-panel judges screen with tables specific to the DCC Lankhmar setting

Reviews

- They Might Be Gazebos: “...the boxed set has stuff you can use no matter what your favorite set of rules may be.”

- Seed of Worlds: “A packed box of all you need to run Lankhmar in the gritty DCC feeling - lots to like if you are doing anything with cities.”

Download the free DCC Lankhmar character sheets!

Lead Designer: Michael Curtis

Lead Artist: Doug Kovacs

Officially licensed from the Estate of Fritz Leiber

dcclankhmar_issue2_thefencesfortuitousfo.human_name: DCC Lankhmar #2: The Fence's Fortuitous Folly
dcclankhmar_issue2_thefencesfortuitousfo.description_text:
A level 2 adventure set in Lankhmar!

Follow those hands! Rooga the Fence has a weakness for the strange and bizarre. When a curious pair of silver-plated skeletal hands animates and escape the shop, where will they lead? Legend claims they will reveal the way to buried treasure. Will the PCs follow?

Following the twisted path, adventurers encounter once-slumbering magic now called back from beyond the grave. Someone, or something, wants them to explore the vaults beneath Lankhmar's streets. The Fence's folly is fortuitous...but fortuitous for whom?

Written by: Daniel J. Bishop

Cover Art by: Ken Kelly

Officially licensed from the Estate of Fritz Leiber

dcclankhmar_issue6_cheatingdeath.description_text:
A level 1 adventure set in Lankhmar!

Death has come to Lankhmar!

It begins as a minor stirring of strange, dangerous coincidences. A ladder falls. A fire erupts. An onlooker plummets from a rooftop, skull-cracking on the chiseled stone below. As conspiracies loom and rumors abound, your band of adventurers must survive the hostile streets of the city and discover the secret that will keep you from Death's cold reach.

Time is running out, and the Lords of Necessity have a dark quota yet to fill as you search for the secret that will fend off the fingers of Death himself. Your quest leads you to a mysterious manor where you must circumvent flood and flame to reach the cage of the long-hidden burned man who offers a gift that just might save your life.

This adventure is suitable for level 1 characters, with information inside about scaling up the threats for any character level. Death knows no level restrictions!

Written by: Tim Callahan

Cover Art by: Sanjulian

Officially licensed from the estate of Fritz Leiber

dcclankhmar_issue12_mercyonthedayoftheee.human_name: DCC Lankhmar #12: Mercy on the Day of the Eel
dcclankhmar_issue12_mercyonthedayoftheee.description_text:
A level 2 DCC adventure set in Lankhmar!

A gang of would-be street legends has offended the master of the Lankhmar Thieves Guild, and the verdict is death. However, the crime lord offers to grant reprieve if the PCs agree to undertake a tricky job on his behalf, a heist where the stolen item must ultimately be returned to the mark without detection!

Of course, things are rarely as straightforward as they seem in the City of Seven-score Thousand Smokes, and this seemingly simple task might lead to an adventure beyond all imagining. What will become of our heroes if they accept mercy on the Day of the Eel?

Written by: Brendan LaSalle

Cover Art by: Doug Kovacs

Officially licensed from the Estate of Fritz Leiber

dcclankhmar_issue8_thelandofeightcities.human_name: DCC Lankhmar #8: The Land of Eight Cities
dcclankhmar_issue8_thelandofeightcities.description_text:
A setting book for Lankhmar!

North of Lankhmar lies The Land of the Eight Cities, a young realm lying in the shadows of the Great Forest and rich in natural resources. This barely-tamed wilderness is rife with opportunities for adventure and riches, but also contains hitherto-unknown dangers. Nevertheless, for adventurers who’ve worn out their welcome in Lankhmar, the Forest Land is a welcoming place to escape their enemies in the City of the Black Toga.

This work is based upon an unpublished manuscript written by Fritz Leiber, one never before seen outside of his personal papers and discovered during a research trip to the University of Houston library. For the first time in decades, new information, creatures, and even gods, all created by Leiber, are presented for use in your DCC Lankhmar campaign! You’ll find details on the people, places, customs, and history of The Land of the Eight Cities, as well as plenty of inspiration for adventures to place there. It’s the perfect resource for when the Thieves’ Guild is breathing down your players’ necks and they need a place to lay low!

Also included in this book is a report University of Houston research trip and select photos of the personal papers and possessions of Fritz Leiber, Harry Otto Fischer, and others housed in the university’s Special Collections department. These images and background information will interest fans of Leiber’s creative genius regardless of whether they are gamers, readers, or both.

Written by: Michael Curtis

Cover Art by: William McAusland

Officially licensed from the Estate of Fritz Leiber

dcclankhmar_patronsoflankhmar.description_text:
From beneath the Outer Ocean, from out of the depths of the Great Salt Marsh, and from the odd fanes of the Street of the Gods, they come: the Patrons of Lankhmar! With the information contained in this tome, a judge can introduce such formidable beings as the Sea King, Mog the Spider God, Sheelba of the Eyeless Face, and even Death himself into any DCC RPG campaign setting.

This early look at the upcoming Dungeon Crawl Classics Lankhmar line introduces a half-dozen supernatural powers and eerie entities for use in your DCC RPG or Lankhmar campaign. Each power’s entry includes details on the entity and their role in Nehwon, tables for invoking that power’s aid, corruption charts for when things go wrong, and new spellburn possibilities. Are you ready to serve the Patrons of Lankhmar?

Written by: Michael Curtis

Cover Art by: Doug Kovacs

Authorized by the Estate of Fritz Leiber

dcclankhmar_issue11_ratsofilthmar.description_text:
A level 3 DCC adventure set in Lankhmar!

A relic sacred to the Rat God lies protected beneath a temple in the trash-ridden city of Ilthmar. Those who venerate the Rat seek to turn the relic’s power against Ilthmar’s most hated rival: Lankhmar, the City of Sevenscore Thousand Smokes!

When Lankhmar’s Overlord learns of this plot, he dispatches a selected party of cut-throats, sorcerers, and alley-fighters to recover the relic before the scheme of the Rat God comes to fruition. But to succeed in their mission, the party will have to infiltrate the deepest depths of the Rat Sect and overcome a multitude of unexpected and dangerous guardians.

Do they have what it takes to succeed in the Overlord’s request—or will they end up another rat-gnawed corpse in the shark-infested waters of Ilthmar?

Written by: Michael Curtis

Cover Art by: Doug Kovacs

Officially licensed from the Estate of Fritz Leiber

nokidhungryconnection.description_text:
Donations to support No Kid Hungry are made to PayPal Giving Fund, subject to its policies.

About No Kid Hungry

No child should go hungry in America. But millions of kids in the United States live with hunger. No Kid Hungry is working to end childhood hunger by helping launch and improve programs that give all kids the healthy food they need to thrive. This is a problem we know how to solve. No Kid Hungry is a campaign of Share Our Strength, an organization committed to ending hunger and poverty. Join us at NoKidHungry.org.

dccgreatestthievesinlankhmarboxedadventu.human_name: DCC "Greatest Thieves in Lankhmar" Boxed Adventure
dccgreatestthievesinlankhmarboxedadventu.description_text:
A level 3 adventure DCC RPG boxed set!

From the most famous city in the history of fantasy comes a sword-and-sorcery adventure that only the best gamers will survive!

The Greatest Thieves in Lankhmar is a Dungeon Crawl Classics adventure that sends characters into the hot cellars beneath Thieves’ House, across the sooty rooftops of the City of Sevenscore Thousand Smokes, and on to a mad dash through the palace of the Overlord. This boxed set comes with everything you need to run an epic adventure over several sessions, whether you run it stand-alone or as part of an ongoing campaign.

When you open the box, you’ll be in the company of legends. The Greatest Thieves in Lankhmar was first run as a tournament at Gen Con 2019, where 20 nationally competitive teams competed over four fantastic days and three hard-fought rounds. Characters died alone, lost beneath Thieves’ House, as their torches burnt out, one by one. After 44% of tables experienced TPKs, and nearly 6 in 10 PCs were killed, one team survived to win the tournament. How will your players compare?

INSIDE THIS BOX YOU WILL FIND:

- A 68-page booklet containing the adventure

- A 20-page book of player handouts

- A 16-page player pack

- A 48-page judge’s pack

- A 12-page scoring sheet

- Die-cut Luck tokens for using Fleeting Luck at the table

- A huge 44” long rooftop chase map, to simulate the chase across the rooftops of Lankhmar

- Plus “Dicing With Death,” a complete stand-alone bonus adventure designed to be deployed when characters die in the main adventure

Officially licensed from the Estate of Fritz Leiber

dcclankhmar_issue13_treacheryinthebeggar.human_name: DCC Lankhmar #13: Treachery in the Beggar City
dcclankhmar_issue13_treacheryinthebeggar.description_text:
A level 3 DCC adventure set in Lankhmar!

Steel flashes in dark alleys and over filth-strewn canals in the Beggar City of Tovilyis! Word has spread that the location of a secret treasure vault belonging to Tovilyis’ old ruler has been discovered. What untold riches await the first to plunder the hidden hoard? The adventurers must compete with other rivals, including masked assassins, sinister sorcerers, and the agents of the Beggar City’s noble houses to be the first to breach the potentate’s private treasury.

Can the adventurers overcome their rivals and the cunning traps of a long-dead ruler or will they become just another set of corpses floating in Tovilyis’ stinking canals come morning? Only keen blades and crafty minds will prevail against Treachery in the Beggar City!

- Adventure in the Beggar City of Tovilyis, home to decadent nobles, sinking buildings, and under the thumb of Lankhmar’s military

- Defeat cunning traps left to defend a merchant king's vast treasury and the resting place of the legendary Scrolls of Night

- This double-sized adventure includes an entire section detailing Tovilyis, including rules for carousing the Beggar City and creating DCC Lankhmar characters born among its canals and winding streets

Written by: Michael Curtis

Cover Art by: Doug Kovacs

Officially licensed from the Estate of Fritz Leiber

dcclankhmar_issue1_ganglordsoflankhmar.human_name: DCC Lankhmar #1: Gang Lords of Lankhmar
dcclankhmar_issue1_ganglordsoflankhmar.description_text:
A level 1 adventure set in Lankhmar!

The City of the Black Toga: Home to hundreds of back alley courts, rotting tenements, and an endless number of gangs, whose fortunes rise and fall as surely as the tides of the Inner Sea. Each gang vies against the others, pitting beggar against bravo, slayer against thug, and gang lord against gang lord.

It’s a Lankhmar story that’s been told a thousand times, and would be entirely forgettable, save for one key element: the characters.

The initial stakes are small as the gangs vie for control of a small slum. But as bodies begin to appear in the Hlal and the shadow war threatens to spill over into street violence, the price of blood favors those who trade in swordwork and black magic.

If they hope to survive, the PCs will need to be both deadly and cunning by turns. For when the first rule of thieves is to never kill the hen that lays brown eggs with ruby in the yolk, old hands know it won’t be long before the Thieves’ Guild moves to protect their interests. May Death himself have mercy on those who stand in their way.

Written by: Harley Stroh

Cover Art by: Doug Kovacs

Officially licensed by the Estate of Fritz Leiber

lankhmar_issue10_unholynightsinlankhmard.human_name: DCC Lankhmar #10: Unholy Nights in Lankhmar
lankhmar_issue10_unholynightsinlankhmard.description_text:
A level 2 holiday adventure set in Lankhmar!

An unnatural night cloaks Lankhmar in perpetual gloom as unknown killers perform ritual murders on its rooftops!

When a specialist in the employ of the party turns up dead, they must investigate the murder to retrieve what is theirs. Unfortunately for them, doing so leads them into the web of a fiendish plot. Vile sorcery strives to resurrect one of the most feared Mingol warlords in Nehwon’s history!

Can the heroes stop this foul rite before it is too late or will unholy night reign forever in the City of the Black Toga?

Written by: Merry Michael Curtis

Cover Art by: Doug Kovacs

Officially licensed from the Estate of Fritz Leiber

dcclankhmar_throughningaublescave.description_text:
Tread in the footsteps of the legendary Fafhrd and the Gray Mouser!

Through Ningauble’s Cave is the first release in the Dungeon Crawl Classics line of Lankhmar supplements. As we build toward a large boxed set, this “first-look” sourcebook provides DCC RPG judges with all the information needed to journey to the world of Nehwon, home to Lankhmar, the fabled City of the Black Toga.

Through Ningauble’s Cave details the secrets of Ningauble of the Seven Eyes. It includes rules for using him as a patron, as well as information on his fantastic cave that touches multiple worlds. With the material in this book, your players can journey to Nehwon...or have Nehwon come to your campaign world!

Look for future releases further exploring the tales of Fafhrd and the Gray Mouser, the creations of world-renowned author Fritz Leiber, and eventually a complete boxed set.

Written by: Michael Curtis

Cover Art by: Doug Kovacs

Authorized by the Estate of Fritz Leiber

nokidhungryconnection.description_text:
Donations to support No Kid Hungry are made to PayPal Giving Fund, subject to its policies.

About No Kid Hungry

No child should go hungry in America. But millions of kids in the United States live with hunger. No Kid Hungry is working to end childhood hunger by helping launch and improve programs that give all kids the healthy food they need to thrive. This is a problem we know how to solve. No Kid Hungry is a campaign of Share Our Strength, an organization committed to ending hunger and poverty. Join us at NoKidHungry.org.

from_bundle.tile_short_name: Last Call for Lankhmar by Goodman Games
from_bundle.marketing_blurb: Get DCC Lankhmar #3: Acting Up in Lankhmar, DCC Lankhmar #1: Gang Lords of Lankhmar, Lankhmar Printed Boxed Set & Adventure Bundle, Dungeon Crawl Classics Lankhmar Campaign Setting, and more!
from_bundle.detailed_marketing_blurb:
Gather your party and take a trip to a city full of adventure and surprise with this bundle of Lankhmar tabletop RPG resources from Dungeon Crawl Classics! Get the entire Lankhmar saga and 15 distinct adventures set within the legendary city, including fan favorites like “The Greatest Thieves in Lankhmar,” “Gang Lords of Lankhmar,” “Blasphemy and Larceny in Lankhmar,” and more! Bring your story to life with the Lankhmar Printed Boxed Set & Adventure Bundle, which features printed maps, the Compendium of Secret Knowledge, and more new material with all the twists and turns needed to satisfy newcomers and veteran players alike. Grab everything you need for your next adventure at the price of your choice, and all purchases support the No Kid Hungry campaign from nonprofit Share Our Strength.

Note: Due to limited quantities, the $40 physical tier is no longer available.
from_bundle.author: Goodman Games

basic_data.human_name: Audio Apocalypse: A World-Ending Collection of Premium Sound & Music
basic_data.detailed_marketing_blurb: We present to you the Audio Apocalypse—a red-hot landscape where the word overpriced has been eliminated! Pay what you want for the ultimate Audio Apocalypse and melt your eardrums with 30+ award-winning audio packs from Ovani Sound. Choose from specialized music plugins for Godot and Unity, a plethora of modular FX packs ranging from horrific to magical, complete genre-specific soundtracks, character voiceover packs, and more. We dare you—go nuclear and blow the minds of your listeners with elite sounds
basic_data.description:
Savings never sounded so good. We present to you the Audio Apocalypse—a red-hot landscape where the word overpriced has been eliminated! Pay what you want for the ultimate Audio Apocalypse and melt your eardrums with 30+ award-winning audio packs from Ovani Sound. Choose from specialized music plugins for Godot and Unity, a plethora of modular FX packs ranging from horrific to magical, complete genre-specific soundtracks, character voiceover packs, and more. We dare you—go nuclear and blow the minds of your listeners with elite sounds!

Pay $1 or more. Normally, the total cost for the software in this bundle is as much as $1,190. Here at Humble Bundle, you choose the price and increase your contribution to upgrade your bundle! This bundle has a minimum $1 purchase. Pay $1 or more to access keys.

Redeem your keys.

Support charity. Choose where the money goes - between the developers and to support Children's Miracle Network. If you like what we do, you can leave us a Humble Tip too!

fantasymusicpack_vol8.description_text:
Returning with Volume 8 of the Fantasy Music Pack by Ovani Sound, this collection conjures another round of enchanting, orchestral, and atmospheric pieces to bring your worlds to life. Perfect for RPGs, adventure games, and cinematic storytelling filled with wonder and mystery.

A total of 50 music files!

With each individual track, you’ll find three different intensity levels, each lasting approximately 90 seconds, along with a 30-second rough cut and a 60-second rough cut. Five different variants per track! With 10 distinct tracks, this diverse selection ensures seamless integration into your projects, providing the perfect musical backdrop.

Furthermore, our tracks offer even more value by seamlessly looping when used with our Music Integration Plugins, providing you with enhanced flexibility for your game development process.

48khz/24bit

childrensmiraclenetworkhospitals.description_text:
Payments to Children's Miracle Network Hospitals are made via the PayPal Giving Fund.

Children's Miracle Network Hospitals raises funds and awareness for 170 member hospitals that provide 32 million treatments each year to kids across the U.S. and Canada. Donations stay local to fund critical treatments and healthcare services, pediatric medical equipment and charitable care. Since 1983, Children's Miracle Network Hospitals has raised more than five billion dollars, most of it one dollar at a time through the charity's Miracle Balloon icon.

ambientmusicpack_vol11.description_text:
Returning with Volume 11 of the Ambient Music Pack by Ovani Sound, this collection expands upon tranquil and immersive soundscapes designed for exploration, introspection, and emotional depth. Perfect for calm atmospheres, meditative scenes, or reflective storytelling in games, films, and creative projects.

A total of 50 music files!

With each individual track, you’ll find three different intensity levels, each lasting approximately 90 seconds, along with a 30-second rough cut and a 60-second rough cut. Five different variants per track! With 10 distinct tracks, this diverse selection ensures seamless integration into your projects, providing the perfect musical backdrop.

Furthermore, our tracks offer even more value by seamlessly looping when used with our Music Integration Plugins, providing you with enhanced flexibility for your game development process.

48khz/24bit

cozycasualsoundfxpack_vol2.human_name: Cozy Casual Sound FX Pack Vol. 2
cozycasualsoundfxpack_vol2.description_text:
Returning with Volume 2 of the Cozy Casual Sound FX Pack by Ovani Sound – a heartwarming collection of sounds that bring life, charm, and personality to relaxing game worlds. Perfect for farming sims, crafting adventures, or any experience where comfort and creativity meet.

With 211 total sounds, this volume expands on the cozy aesthetic with thoughtfully designed layers of interaction, environment, and feedback:

• 60 User Interface Sounds – Soft clicks, taps, and swipes with a friendly, tactile quality. Designed to feel organic and satisfying for crafting menus, inventory systems, or puzzle UIs. • 61 Item and Inventory Sounds – Detailed Foley for collecting, equipping, planting, and using objects. Includes drops, moves, pickups, and equip sounds that make item handling feel smooth and rewarding. • 31 Environmental and Footstep Sounds – Includes footsteps on wood and gravel, light door actions, and gentle ambient touches like rain and indoor movement for immersive, homely spaces. • 31 Garden and Tool Sounds – Pull weeds, trim plants, rustle seed bags, and use tools with earthy textures and natural warmth—ideal for farming or outdoor crafting systems. • 18 Wood and Construction Sounds – Knocks, scrapes, and light building cues that add physical depth to carpentry, upgrades, and structure interactions. • 6 Whoosh Sounds – Clean, soft transitions and motion effects for subtle UI or environmental movement.

Every sound was recorded and mixed to retain a cozy realism—detailed enough for simulation games, yet gentle enough for casual gameplay.

44.1kHz / 16bit Each file includes metadata for quick search and seamless implementation.

horrormusicpackvol2.description_text:
Returning with Volume 2 of the Horror Music Pack by Ovani Sound, a premium collection of royalty-free music crafted specifically for your games, films, and other creative projects. Screeching music and untold horrors will certainly frighten you beyond fictional worlds.

A total of 50 music files!

With each individual track, you’ll find three different intensity levels, each lasting approximately 90 seconds, along with a 30-second rough cut and a 60-second rough cut. Five different variants per track! With 10 distinct tracks, this diverse selection ensures seamless integration into your projects, providing the perfect musical backdrop.

Furthermore, our tracks offer even more value by seamlessly looping when used with our Music Integration Plugin, providing you with enhanced flexibility for your game development process.

steampunksoundfxpack_vol3.description_text:
Returning with Volume 3 of the Steampunk Sound FX Pack by Ovani Sound – an industrial symphony of clanks, hisses, and mechanical rhythms built for alternate-history worlds and clockwork creations.

With 192 total sounds, this collection captures the mechanical wonder of brass-era invention and the gritty pulse of steam-driven machinery—perfect for adventure, factory, or fantasy-industrial projects:

• 25 Mechanism Sounds – Clicking gears, ratchets, locks, and rotating assemblies that define the tactile heart of steampunk engineering. Perfect for intricate contraptions, robotics, or mechanical traps. • 50 Gas & Steam Sounds – Pressure bursts, squeaks, valve releases, and kettle vents that breathe realism into boilers, pipes, and reactive machinery. Each layer conveys movement, tension, and release. • 54 Handling Sounds – Hands-on interactions with tools, lights, chains, and reloads, from subtle switch clicks to heavy metallic adjustments. Adds the human touch to complex machinery. • 29 Lever & Pump Sounds – Hydraulic squeaks, mechanical pulls, and winding gears for interactive props and vehicle mechanisms. Each sample features organic weight and textured resistance. • 10 Impact Sounds – Metallic collisions, toasts, and clangs for signaling motion, malfunction, or steampunk-style explosions. • 24 Mechanical Loops – Continuous ambiences and machinery beds, including Steam Engine, Boiler Room, Pump Machine, and Bike Chain Loops, for powering immersive industrial environments.

Meticulously layered with mechanical realism and old-world charm, this volume offers a versatile toolkit for worldbuilders crafting airships, automatons, or entire clockwork cities.

44.1kHz / 16bit Each file includes detailed metadata for fast implementation.

unrealmusicplugin.description_text: Adding music to a game can be overwhelming. Our Unreal Audio Plugin takes the headache out of the process and frees you to handle the more creative aspects of game development. You’ll see how you are able to easily trigger changes in song intensity, song selection, and random song play through our easy to use UI. All of this while working with seamless looping capability. Pair this with one of our specially-made music packs, and you’re set up to make a captivating experience that players can get lost in.

playerstatussoundfxpack_vol3.human_name: Player Status Sound FX Pack Vol. 3
playerstatussoundfxpack_vol3.description_text:
Returning with Volume 3 of the Player Status Sound FX Pack by Ovani Sound – an extensive collection of expressive feedback sounds crafted for health systems, buffs, debuffs, and state changes.

With 180 total sounds, this pack delivers the ultimate toolkit for representing player condition and transformation in any genre—from RPGs and survival titles to action and simulation games:

• 37 Positive Buff & Cure Sounds – Heals, purges, charges, and strength enhancements like Healed, Purged, Sharpened, and Strengthened. Each one radiates clarity and satisfaction, ideal for progression, recovery, or power-up cues. • 31 Player Vitals & Needs Sounds – Urgent indicators for hunger, low energy, oxygen, and even lighthearted moments like Needs Bathroom or Music Ready. Adds immersion and humor to survival or sim gameplay. • 29 Mental & Magical Debuff Sounds – Distorted and eerie cues for Confused, Cursed, Haunted, Hypnotized, and Feared states. Designed with haunting tonal movement and glitch-inspired processing for psychological depth. • 27 Physical Debuff Sounds – Frozen, Greased, Slipped, Shrunk, and Stunned effects featuring crunchy, tactile design for impactful feedback when players suffer status ailments. • 20 System & Tech Status Sounds – Analyzing, Hacked, Tech Broken, and Digital Fear layers for cybernetic or sci-fi contexts where status alerts meet system damage. • 20 Action & Interaction Sounds – Contextual sounds for gameplay moments like Ready, Hold, Found, and Unstuck, perfect for notifying or reinforcing key interactions. • 16 Transformation & Special Mode Sounds – Dramatic metamorphoses like Beast Formed, Goblin Mode, Growth, and Holy Charging—complete with reversals such as Un-Beast Formed for seamless transitions between modes.

From classic RPG buffs to comedic survival effects, every sound in this volume is designed to make status changes feel distinct, immersive, and full of personality.

44.1kHz / 16bit Each file includes detailed metadata for fast implementation.

openandclosesoundfxpack.description_text:
Introducing the Open & Close Sound FX Pack by Ovani Sound – a comprehensive collection of tactile opening/closing actions captured in two mix-ready spaces: Mostly Dry (tight, close-mic detail) and Much Room (larger, reverberant environments). Ideal for games, film, and UI where believable motion and material detail matter.

With 330 total sounds, this pack spans vehicles, doors, windows, blinds, and containers across metal, wood, plastic, glass, and fabric:
